H0.text: which states does the colorado river run through. Arizona

H1.text: which states does the colorado river run through. California

H2.text: which states does the colorado river run through. Nevada

H3.text: which states does the colorado river run through. Utah

A4.text: The basin extends into southeastern Nevada and California, and most of Arizona.

A5.text: The basin extends into eastern and southern Utah.

A6.text: Arizona v. California and the Colorado River.

A7.text: The Upper Basin includes parts of Colorado, New Mexico, Utah, and Wyoming and a small portion of Arizona.

A8.text: Phoenix, Arizona, Las Vegas, Nevada and Mexicali, Baja California are the largest cities by population within the Colorado River Basin.

A9.text: The Colorado River flows generally southwest across the Colorado Plateau and through the Grand Canyon before reaching Lake Mead on the Arizona–Nevada border.

A10.text: The Colorado River turns south toward the international border after reaching Lake Mead on the Arizona–Nevada border.
